intro: Sedum guadalajaranum, commonly known as the Guadalajara stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Sedum guadalajaranum is drought-tolerant and requires minimal maintenance once established.
